results.title: Independent living centre [Serbian Version]
results.brief_description: Outlines the highly specialised and unique services of the Independent Living Centre in Victoria which aims to assist people with disabilities to enhance their independence and quality of life by providing demonstrations, advice and information on a comprehensive range of aids and equipment for daily living. Narrated in Serbian.

results.title: Incommunicado
results.brief_description: An example of student film production: to the accompaniment of Elizabeth Honey singing, an Edwardian period piece is unravelled in shots of costumes, bric-a-brac and objects d’arts of the time.

results.title: In waters of the Persian Gulf
results.brief_description: A picture of life along the coasts of the Persian Gulf. Here life is a battle - a struggle for existence with the desert and with the sea. In the markets of the villages, the products of cottage industries are exchanged for the products of the sea or of the desert. But everywhere water is scarce. On the coast ships are built; ships for the trade of the gulf, for the fishermen and for the pearling industry.

results.title: In the wake of Mendana
results.creator_credit: Norman K Wallis and Western Pacific High Commission
results.brief_description: An impression of life in the British Solomon Islands. Shows the natural vegetation of the islands; native villages; schools; hospitals; churches; industries; activities of the natives - singing, dancing, canoe racing. Mentions the history of the islands and the administration.

results.title: In the USA
results.brief_description: Made to promote the attractions of the United States to the prospective visitor, this film shows airport and hotel registration procedures, the multi-lingual services available, and some of the popular tourist spots - New York, Washington and San Francisco.

results.title: In the Mind's Eye
results.creator_credit: David Blake, Emma Buckland and Jess Chapkoun
results.brief_description:
The final outcome from a work experience project with Swinburne Unversity of Technology (TAFE) Multimedia Course, Computing and IT Department. “How do you communicate? Do you really listen? Do you respond to what’s been said or do you just talk about your own memory and experience? Dive into “The minds
eye”, a small film that explores what it will take for us to pay attention and react. Directed Written and Produced by Jess Chapkoun, Emma Buckland and David Blake.
Music by Susan Ellis & Stuart Porter and Ivan Rosa & Matthew Farrington

results.title: In the crash
results.creator_credit: Leo Trachtenberg, Roger Reidy, Harvest Films and Insurance Institute for Highway Safety
results.brief_description: Despite ‘accident prevention’ campaigns, millions of cars continue to crash each year. This documentary argues that legislation needs to be introduced to address better safety standards in car and highway designs. Uses footage of highway crashes, controlled safety tests, and potential highway hazards to demonstrates how injury and property damage can be reduced through design. Demonstrates features designed to reduce personal injury such as seat belts, air bags, laminated windscreens, padded daashboards, shock absorbing steering columns, anchored seats and head rests. Also looks at highway design, demonstrating good and bad examples of traffic islands, barriers, signage poles and lamp posts.
